results.title: Fields of sacrifice
results.brief_description: A memorable tribute to more than 100,000 Canadians who gave their lives in the service of their country on foreign battlegrounds. The film visits battlefields of the first and second World Wars and cemeteries where servicemen are buried. Filmed from Hong Kong to Sicily, this documentary is designed to show Canadians places they have reason to know but may not be able to visit. The footage shot on location by Eugene Boyko is imaginatively intercut with archival footage. Douglas Rain narrates this award winning film scripted by Donald Brittain. Edited by Rex Tasker. (Awards: Columbus, Victoria, Toronto)

results.title: Field of dreams
results.creator_credit: Gordon Company, Lawrence Gordon, Charles Gordon and Phil Alden Robinson
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “Shoeless Joe” by W. P. Kinsella, this is the story of one man’s quest to transform vision to reality. “If you build it, he will come” is the ethereal message that inspires Iowa farmer Ray Kinsella (Kevin Costner) to construct a baseball diamond in the middle of his cornfield. At first “he” seems to be the ghost of disgraced ballplayer “Shoeless” Joe Jackson (Ray Liotta), who materialises on the ballfield and plays a few games with the awestruck Ray. However he gradually he comes to realise that his ballfield has been divinely ordained to give a second chance to people who have sacrificed certain valuable aspects of their lives, including a Salingeresque writer (James Earl Jones) and Doc Graham (Burt Lancaster), who gave up a promising career in baseball in favour of medicine. The film is a celebration of the love of baseball.

results.title: Field events
results.creator_credit: Jan Ladlo and Associated Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fundamentals of the Track and Field for Girls”.
This film designed as a teaching tool, emphasizes form and techniques. The field events such as long jump; standing broad jump; high jump; discus; shot put; and javelin are explained.

results.title: Field Diary
results.brief_description: This film examines the Israeli occupation of the West Bank. Israeli filmmaker Amos Gitai interviews Israeli soldiers, Palestinians whose homes have been destroyed or taken from them, and new Israeli settlers.

results.title: Fidelio
results.brief_description: Glyndebourne Festival Opera 1979 production of Beethoven’s “Fidelio” with words by J.N. Bouilly, J.F. Sonnleithner and F. Treitschke, produced by Peter Hall with the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Bernard Haitink and the Glyndebourne Chorus. Set in a Spanish prison, the opera tells of a wife, Leonore (Elisabeth Soderstrom), who, disguised as a man (Fidelio), enters the prison to free her husband, the prisoner, Florestan (Anton de Ridder). Cast also includes Ian Caley (Jaquino), Elizabeth Gale (Marzelline), Curt Appelgren (Rocco), Robert Allman (Don Pizarro) and Michael Langdon (Don Fernando). Sung in German with English subtitles.

results.title: Fidelio
results.creator_credit: Stephane Tchalgadjieff, Daniele Gegauff and Pierre Jourdan
results.brief_description:
This performance of ‘Fidelio’, Beethoven’s only opera was recorded at the antique theatre of Orange (France). The ‘Philharmonic Orchestra of Israel’ is conducted by Zubin Mehta, with the ‘New Philharmonia’ choir of London. The stage direction is by Alfred Lipmann. The performance is introduced by an extract from ‘Napoleon et la Revolution’ directed by Abel Gance. ‘Fidelio’ was composed in reaction to the shattered hopes of the French Revolution and Napoleon’s encroaching grip over Europe. It is a classic love story in which liberty and justice triumph of oppression and tyranny thanks to the steely resolve of love.

Credits: Producers, Daniele Gegauff, Stephane Tchalgadjieff ; director, Pierre Jourdain ; photography, Michel Kelber.
Cast: Gundula Janovitz, Jon Vickers, Theo Adam.

results.title: Fidel Castro: maximum leader
results.creator_credit: Stephen Leigh, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
‘Fidel Castro: maximum leader’ chronicles the rise of Cuba’s most infamous dignitary. Born in an era when Cuba was the playground of Americans fleeing prohibition, Castro became interested in student activism and witnessed the changing of leaders between Presidents Gomez and Battista. He led a gang of guerrilla rebels into the mountains, and after several unsuccessful insurrections into the capital, was finally successful in overthrowing Battista - thanks to intervention by Eisenhower. Throughout his career Castro would form Communist alliances and create a highly sensitive relationship between Cuba and America. Includes footage from the Cuban Missile Crisis and the Bay of Pigs invasion. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Fiddler on the roof
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Mirisch Corporation and Norman Jewison
results.brief_description: A marvellous film version of the Jerry Bock/Sheldon Harnick Broadway musical. It tells the story of an impoverished Russian-Jewish family headed by Tevye (played by Topol), the village milkman, and his wife, Golda. Their three eldest daughters seek husbands of their own choosing rather than those chosen by the village matchmaker. Then a cruel anti-Jewish pogrom forces the family to flee to America and start a new life. The musical was itself adapted from Shalom Aleichem’s story, “Tevye and his Daughters”.
